page.title: 02SHOPPING SURVEY
page.content: The children of Hinstock School made a study of 46 houses that stretched diagonally across the area. We found that 60% of the households did their main shopping at Market Drayton and all but one of the rest shopped at Newport. Both townships are about 5 miles away from the centre of the area. One household (a one parent family) shopped solely at the small village shop at Hinstock. It was found that most households did their main shop once a week supplimenting this with visits to the local shop. 80% of the households used their own transport to shop, the rest used public transport.
